intro: Flemingia lamontii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers followed by elongated, woody pods that contain flat, edible seeds. Flemingia lamontii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant foliage and unique seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adaptable to various climatic conditions.
